snippet: New York Road Runners will have to limit the number of new entrants to accommodate runners who had the right to compete after they missed last year’s canceled race.
abstract: New York Road Runners say about half of runners registered for 2012 New York City Marathon, which was canceled after Hurricane Sandy, chose to have their entry fee refunded, and other half chose to run in future marathon or half marathon.
lead_paragraph: New York Road Runners will have to limit the number of new entrants to accommodate runners who had the right to compete after they missed last year’s canceled race.

headline.seo: Half of New York City Marathon Runners Opt for Refund
headline.main: Half of New York City Marathon Entrants Opt for a Refund
headline.print_headline: Half of Registrants Opt for a Refund
